column4: /usr/bin/python^M: bad interpreter: No such file or directory, why does it say this? there is no "^M" there?
yep, the file was probably saved on windows or mac and they format new lines differently.  dos2unix (in the tofrodos package) will convert it
no need to google, just install that package using synaptic or apt-get
i searched, but found no package : )
its the default one, i've just activated the outcommented the commented repos :)
well it's there if you have the main repository enabled
yep, updated, i uncommented the src-stuff to, no luck.
what package are you looking for?
tofrodos is the package name, "dos2unix" is the command
